page.description: Return the tables in a set that can be represented with a lookup expression to the table.
page.discussion: The TABLE.RELATED_TABLES_GET() method returns a list of the tables in a set that can represented with a lookup expression to the table. It indicates what tables are linked to a particular table in a set in such a way that for a given record in the reference table, there is only ONE matching related record.

section.title: Example
section.description: The following examples relate to the AlphaSports database. For a given record in "invoice_items" there is one (and only one linked record) in the listed tables.
section.example: dim s as P s = set.open_session("invoice.set") ? s.invoice_items.related_tables_get("invoice_items") = Invoice_Items product vendor Invoice_Header Customer
